solution_line_template: First find the total number of minutes Gretchen spends sitting at her desk: {sitting_hours} hours * {minutes_per_hour} minutes/hour = <<{sitting_hours}*{minutes_per_hour}={total_sitting_minutes}>>{total_sitting_minutes} minutes

Then divide this amount by {sitting_interval_minutes} minutes to find how many walking breaks Gretchen takes: {total_sitting_minutes} minutes / {sitting_interval_minutes} minutes/break = <<{total_sitting_minutes}/{sitting_interval_minutes}={num_walking_breaks}>>{num_walking_breaks} breaks

Then multiply the number of breaks by the length of each break to find how long Gretchen spends walking: {num_walking_breaks} breaks * {walking_break_duration} minutes/break = <<{num_walking_breaks}*{walking_break_duration}={total_walking_minutes}>>{total_walking_minutes} minutes
